data.title: Great fresh food!
data.text: Firebox is a wonderful and romantic farm to table place.  Terrific!  Always!!  Some unique items that are seasonal and fresh.

data.title: Great meal in a repurposed venue~
data.text: Was here for dinner at this edge of downtown restaurant located in near the State capitol building in a renovated forge that offers a farm-to-table New American menu.  For my meal I had a Scottish Salmon served with Black pearl lentils and a cilantro sauce reduction.  For the drink I had a 12 oz beer from Frangingham.  Total cost was $38 which I thought was amazing due to the high quality of the ingredients and the execution on my plate.  Taste was very good.  Definitely plan on checking this place out.  I'm sure word will spread and it will be very busy soon!

data.title: Nice Sunday Brunch
data.text: We were in Hartford for a wedding and decided to treat ourselves to a nice brunch. It was perfect. Great place with delicious food, huge windows, lots of light and friendly staff. Food was fresh and surprisingly filling. The coffee was high quality and free refills. We also liked the restaurant's mission, investment and connection with the local community.

data.title: I like my food served HOT!
data.text: My husband and I had dinner here on Wed. night before going to The Bushnell.  I've got to cut to the chase and just say, their food is quite good, but both courses that I had were not served hot, they were warm.  I got the butternut squash soup for my appetizer and it was warm.  I realize it can't be served so hot that someone might burn themselves, but this was warm.  Luckily, I had just ordered a cup, because it would have been cold before I finished a bowl. For my entree, I ordered the Cast Iron Duck with hominy grits.  It came out warm, as well.  My husband ordered the Beef Cheek Ragout, which came out steaming hot (literally!)  So, I enjoyed both courses, but would have enjoyed them much more if they were served HOT.  I didn't say anything to our server, but did mention to someone else who was filling our water all night.  He said he would mention it to the chef.

data.title: Nice surprise
data.text:
We had a nice dinner.
I really liked that we could get organic chicken, and it was delicious. I had a glass of the muscato it was nice and sweet and I really enjoyed it. 
My husband had the duck and he didn't love it, but I am not a fan of duck and never like it anywhere.
The place had a nice atmosphere and the service was good. If we lived closer we would go back for sure.

data.title: Trying a new place
data.text: Food and atmosphere was fantastic. Menu had something for everyone. Service was helpful and friendly but not very consistent. Brought the wrong drink and small-plate after initial order. Restaurant ran out of bread. Other than those two minor things, great spot. Awesome flavors. Salmon, Duck and Chicken were all cooked perfectly and would recommend all three. Looking forward to next visit.

data.title: Wonderful exciting menu!
data.text:
While there are not a lot of selections on the menu, there is something for everyone! Everything was so fresh! I had the special grilled eggplant and sweet potato purée to start, wonderful!
My husband had the kale salad, it was good, but there are other nice choices.
Waitress was excellent. Only downside was the food seem to take a long time to come out of the kitchen. We eat early, 5:30, and the place was busy but not packed, so next time I will have a snack before I go. Bread that came to the table was cold, which I was very surprised about. Not even room temp, but cold.
I highly recommend this restaurant and plan to go again.

data.title: Scrumptious Brunch
data.text: Firebox has a wonderful brunch menu selection.  We had the kielbasa which came with grits and the egg sandwich with chicken sausage along with a side of brussel sprouts.  The food is locally sourced so that's probably why the greens and everything else was so delicious.  Service was friendly and efficient.  We enjoyed eating outside in the sunshine.

data.title: Best Brunch
data.text: Love the brunch at Firebox. We had a group for brunch a few weeks ago. Great booze brunch cocktails -lots to choose from. Food was excellent, fresh and unique. We each had a brunch entree and shared a few sides- I had the quiche was was a truly great choice- tried the french toast-- a winner- also tried the hummus, brussels and potatoes - all wonderful- I highly recommend for a great choice in Hartford!

data.title: Fantastic and locally grown
data.text: Enjoyed a really fantastic dinner. Kicked it off with roasted Brussels sprouts!! I mean... Really amazing! Followed them with a beautifully cooked black pearl salmon. Lovely setting inside or outside.

data.title: Wish I stayed home
data.text: because I was very disappointed with this restaurant. Had heard good reports and took an opportunity to try it. The place was not busy and I cannot remember exactly what I  ordered but it was terrible. I am a foodie who was raised to eat anything as well as clean my plate so it is very difficult to disappoint me. I must add it may have been an "off" day and not the norm. Unfortunately, I have not returned mainly because the area of Greater Hartford has many very excellent venues when my time and money allow dining out.

data.title: Great local food and good service
data.text: A changing menu, locally sourced food, good service. Well worth the trip. Bar at front is nicely done.

data.title: What's Up Doc?
data.text: The what's up doc specialty cocktail, with rum and fresh carrot juice, was easily the best drink I have ever had.  Pan roasted duck was seared and cooked perfectly, and what an amazing atmosphere.

data.title: Amazing
data.text: I have now had the best caesar salad of my life. The specialty drinks were wonderful. The bread was delicious. And the dessert was incredible. Im ruined for life for other restaurants. Thank you firebox. We will return. Dont let the poor neighborhood fool you. This place knows what good food is!!!!!!!!!!!!

data.title: Brunch-to-Lunch
data.text:
Restaurant: Our first time here. Note- the restaurant uses local growers for as much of their menu as they can. Go to the website and check it out. Quite a nice history and they are part of the neighborhood revival effort going on in that part of Hartford. 
We were seated on the covered patio.

Drinks:I ordered a morning freshener, an O.J./pomegranate/ginger beer Zip. Self-explanatory and quite good since the ginger beer syrup is hand made by the chef. Non-alcoholic and this could be healthy as well. 
Joanie got a latte which she really liked. Sean had a glass of wine, Devon had water...

Three appetizers: 1.) White Bean Hummus/dill dip with CoCo flour bread. 2.) A small plate of veggies for dipping. I'm use to conventional chickpea hummus so this was a nice surprise with, of course, a white bean flavor. Lighter and thinner consistency. The dill spread on top added some texture which helped the hummus. I didn't eat the bread but did try the veggies. Very good!

3.) Also had the sauteed brussel sprouts in a sweet base of, what, I think was either honey or molasses. Probably the latter. Pieces of almond for a crunchy experience.  Really incredible taste so I highly recommend trying this with a few people because it is a large share-plate.

Joanie: Hamburger and fries. Burger tasty and cooked to perfection. I tried one of the fries and this is not the way I like them. These were left soaking in the oil and had a harder consistency so not my thing. She didn't eat them either. The only part of the experience that surprised us both. "Head-strong chef butts head with normal-fries public taste ." I don't think these will last long on the menu, hopefully they get a clue.

I had the salmon cakes with a squash pasta garnished with the Bearnaise "egg-Benedict sauce" and  tomatoes. I consider this style "cake" a fish cake so I'm not going to go into too much detail because it was very good, though I am use to much more texture and flavor. I think this was just a native chef -inspired recipe. Joanie makes fish cakes that have a chunkier texture with lots of flavors so maybe I'm just spoiled. As I said, these were very good and I would have them again.

Sean had the mussels in a mystery sauce that he really enjoyed. Devon had the egg-Benedict with veggies since they were already out of the eggs-Benedict with salmon. We were alll so hungry so everything was very, very fresh and delicious.

We ate outside on the covered patio but I did go inside to check out the rest of the restaurant and it was very upscale. The brick building was rehabbed in that area and they did a great job.

I recommend it and would go back to try out some of the other eclectic local-growers fare. It's also good to support this effort to go beyond the menu and use local businesses. The chef isn't afraid to veer off the standard path into uncharted waters so any criticism here is solely based on my own likes and dislikes in my comfort food zone. Everything was very good and I am sure you would fine a lot to like on the menu.

data.title: Nice farm to table.
data.text: This restaurant is trying to revitalize the neighborhood, that being said it's not in the greatest neighborhood.  We had no problems with it whatsoever. The food was good and so is the service. We would've liked a few more small plates on the menu but it wasn't a turn off for us. We were running late with our reservations and they had no problem getting us a table.

data.title: Excellent food, great for date night
data.text: Delicious unique dishes.  We had two kids and two adults and there weren't kid friendly options so we ordered three meals and shared them family style.  It was quite good and the kids found enough to eat.  I like that it challenged them to try new foods!

data.title: Decent fresh chef level food, loud atmosphere
data.text: My wife and I have been here a few times over the years and the chefs reach to create quality dishes and sometimes reach it.  I had a  pork belly entree that just done poorly and was near inedible, and other times had fish dishes that were among the best I've ever had.

data.title: Lovely Experience
data.text: The Firebox restaurant is 5 stars for many reasons. First of all the restaurant is in an old brick building which gives it a really cool vibe and atmosphere. The staff is professional and knowledgeable. The food is fabulous. I had the duck and my boyfriend had the steak. We also shared a cheese plate appetizer. Everything was cooked perfectly, very fresh and delicious. I understand that they use locally sourced meats and vegetables and it certainly does taste it. The best part of the evening was the fact that my boyfriend arranged to have a beautiful bouquet of flowers set on the table for me when we arrived. You may not get this extra bonus when you go, but it will still be  well worth the visit.

data.title: Fresh and tasty
data.text: Always love firebox for its fresh, local and delicious food. Menu constantly changes and chef is consistently innovative with ingredients,  flavors and plating. Always letting the freshness and quality speak for itself. My favorite restaurant in Hartford by far. An absolute treat every time!
